titleStmt.title: The conuerted Iew or Certaine dialogues betweene Micheas a learned Iew and others, touching diuers points of religion, controuerted betweene the Catholicks and Protestants. Written by M. Iohn Clare a Catholicke priest, of the Society of Iesus. Dedicated to the two Vniuersities of Oxford and Cambridge ...
titleStmt.author: Clare, John, 1577-1628.

titleStmt.title: The conuerted Iew or Certaine dialogues betweene Micheas a learned Iew and others, touching diuers points of religion, controuerted betweene the Catholicks and Protestants. Written by M. Iohn Clare a Catholicke priest, of the Society of Iesus. Dedicated to the two Vniuersities of Oxford and Cambridge ...
titleStmt.author: Clare, John, 1577-1628.
Anderton, Lawrence, attributed name.
Anderton, Roger, d. 1640?, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the English secret press] Permissu superiorum,

notesStmt.note: Sometimes attributed to Lawrence or Roger Anderton.
Identification of printer from STC; however, the style of signing the preliminaries is French.

The second part has separate dated title page, pagination, and register. It has an appendix in reply to: Abbot, George. A treatise of the perpetuall visibilitie, and succession of the true Church in all ages.
The third part, "The arraignment of the conuerted Iew", has divisional title and separate pagination and register.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
